p: In addition to diosgenin, other steroidal saponins have been reported in several Dioscorea species. An extensive review by Sautour et al. [ 151] revealed over 50 saponins in 13 Dioscorea species, including D. cayenensis, D. bulbifera, D. colletii, D. futschauensis, D. deltoidea, D. panthaica, D. nipponica, D. pseudojaponica, D. parviflora, D. spongiosa, D. polygonoides, D. zingiberensis and D. villosa. The authors also highlighted the pharmacological properties of the saponins as regards cytotoxic and antifungal properties.
